Intervention: 5-Fluorouracil, epirubicin with cyclophosphamide (FEC), trastuzumab and pertuzumab every three weeks for three cycles, followed by docetaxel, trastuzumab and pertuzumab every three weeks, for three cycles as neoadjuvant therapy. Trastuzumab every three weeks from cycle 7 to cycle 17 as adjuvant post-surgery therapy.

- FEC every three weeks for three cycles, followed by docetaxel, trastuzumab and pertuzumab every three weeks, for three cycles as neoadjuvant treatment. Trastuzumab every three weeks from cycle 7 to cycle 21 as post-surgery adjuvant treatment.
Eligibility: Advanced, inflammatory or early unilateral invasive breast cancer
• Metastatic disease (stage IV) or bilateral breast cancer
Previous anticancer treatment or radiation therapy for malignancy
Other malignancies, except in situ carcinoma of the cervix or basal cell carcinoma
Current chronic treatment with corticosteroids of >10mg methylprednisolone or equivalent
Results: Safety: Percentage of participants with symptomatic heart events assessed by the investigator
- Left ventricular systolic dysfunction (LCVD) as evaluated by the investigator, including symptomatic Grade 3, 4 or 5 DVL with symptomatic heart events.
Time limit: from base to about 3.5 years
Title of the arm/group: T+P Anthracycline-based chemotherapy

Description of the arm/group: 5-Fluorouracil, epirubin with cyclophosphamide (FEC), trastuzumab and pertuzumab every three weeks for three cycles followed by docetaxel, trastuzumab and pertuzumab every three weeks for three cycles as neoadjuvant therapy Trastuzumab every three weeks from cycle 7 to cycle 17 as post-surgery adjuvant therapy.
Title of the arm/group: Sequential anthracycline-based chemotherapy T+P

Description of the arm/group: CSE every three weeks for three cycles, followed by docetaxel, trastuzumab and pertuzumab every three weeks, for three cycles as neoadjuvant treatment. Trastuzumab every three weeks from cycle 7 to cycle 21 as post-surgery adjuvant treatment.
Unit of measure: percentage of participants 2.7
